instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1466 820-00165
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1466 820-00165 that has green light, but no fan spin and pulls only 25mA on bench PSU.

PPBUS_G3H = 0V

F7140 seamed to be shorted and so I removed (no continuity). On pad 2 I get  0.24 ohm and 0.000 mV on diode mode.
I inject 2.5V on PPBUS_G3H but nothing gets hot.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1466 820-00165
threads.message:
It was a broken cap.
Solved. Tks.

threads.title: A1466 820-00165
threads.message:
You've had luck this time.
STOP to inject voltage into PPBUS_G3H in this manner.
2.5V could kill the CPU.
So many times talking about this on the forum...
